title: What is your stand about citation and plagiarism? - Quora

response.answer_text: Plagiarism is regarded as a serious “academic crime” and most universities/colleges regard it as grounds for expulsion. And for the record, plagiarism extends beyond verbatim copying of texts. PLAGIARISM brochure As this brochure points out it not only includes copying text (with various amounts of changes) but extends to using someone else’s ideas without attribution. For that matter there is even something called “self-plagiarism”. Conclusion - cite your sources very carefully.

Citations document for your readers where you obtained your material, provide a means of critiquing your study based on the sources you used and create an opportunity to obtain information about prior studies of the research problem under investigation. The act of citing sources is also your best defense against allegations of plagiarism. The idea of citing sources isn’t about referring words but it is about referencing the idea that the author communicated. Even if you rewrite sentences in your own words, that is mere paraphrasing hence it is imperative to cite sources in research.
